website_summaries.verdict: A fast and fun gaming keyboard that is fairly easy to program and is sturdy enough to carry around with a laptop.
pros: Fast, responsive keys, with uniform pressure
cons: Keys may be too sensitive for accurate typing

customer_reviews.title: I hate this keyboard and you will too.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this keyboard now for 6 months and I still double type letters or accidentally hit buttons I didn't mean to press. The keyboard overreacts and easily considers the slightest touch a double tap. If I didn't pay so much for this keyboard I would smash it to pieces. Never corrected so many typing errors as I have in the last 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Keys double tap 1 month after purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Keys double tap like "EE" and "RR" when pressing them only once. This happens very occasionally but extremely frustrating. Corsair has been extremely slow to deal with for RMA, would not recommend. UPDATE - after paying Corsair to ship out RMA, their 2nd keyboard is now suffering from the same issue of the E key double tapping after only a few months again.
customer_reviews.author: newboarder

customer_reviews.title: One gorgeous board!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just as beautiful as I was hoping it would be! I still love the switches from these boards, but that's just me. I wouldn't say it would be worth upgrading from the original K70 unless you just love the color that much since it's mostly otherwise the same, albeit with a few different button placements, or if you find it on a good sale.. or both! The white buttons so far haven't began to show any signs of dirt from fingertips, but the same cannot be said for the wrist-rest! That thing was showing dirt within a week or two and seems pretty miserable to clean and probably not worth the effort. Just something to think about!
customer_reviews.author: Drew E.

customer_reviews.title: one of the best looking keyboards ever.
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between the white & the black version. I would've been happy with either or. But the white is made with better keycaps and surprisingly doesnt get dirty as quickly as literally every other white product in existence. I believe both versions of this keyboard are worth their price. Definitely dont buy this if you are on a budget. there are keyboards that are just as good for only a fraction of the price. That being said, if you want the coolest looking build ever then id definitely go for this or one of them typewriter looking keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Markiss

customer_reviews.title: ISSUE IF YOU HAVE AN OMEN PC BY HP
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels and looks amazing. Problem i had and also many many others after searching online is that the Corsair software can cause issues with HP desktops. It will get you stuck in the logo screen when booting up your PC. I had to unplug the keyboard and turn the computer on again for it to get to the log in page and then i could plug it back in. Had to return this keyboard since i was unable to use the software with it and with that issue it's not worth 130$ or w/e it was at the time of purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jovan

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I've used Corsair products in the past and for the most part, I've found them to be quite reliable; so, when I needed a keyboard for my new Hobbit PC build (which is using a Corsair 760T white case) the CORSAIR K70 RGB MK.2 SE Mechanical Keyboard is what I found. It complements the case quite nicely and gets away from this boring black them most manufacturers seem to go for. To be honest, I haven't actually completed the new build yet as I'm still working on getting the other components but mostly it's modifying the inside and outside of the case.
customer_reviews.author: jawnTEM

customer_reviews.title: Complete the Look... With Lights!!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to finish with this combo. My first mechanical keyboard. Feels great to type in. Not too loud and very responsive, has that little kickback that I like. Also really like the wrist support provided with it. The mouse I updgraded from the Non pro version. This mouse is perfect and heavy, great clicks and durable ( I'm still using my old one on my laptop over 5 years and clicking away). The lights work with CORSAIR ICUE like the rest of your rig, ease to manage via the app and it all flows together....like magic....
customer_reviews.author: Some guy

customer_reviews.title: Low profile switches aren't for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Low profile switches are notably muddier than the standard ones. The keys are still raised by a lot and will never come close to laptop-style keyboards. Actuation distance is too short for my tastes. This keyboard is not for everyone and not worth trying imo unless you have a specific use for low profile keys (like hand fatigue).
customer_reviews.author: Hao

customer_reviews.title: I received a defective Corsair K70 Mk.2 Low Profile
customer_reviews.text: I ordered for a Corsair K70 Mk.2 Low Profile. The 8 and/or * key was broken, I had to full press the top left part of the key to activate the key and I'd have to really put an effort to activate the key so it would register as a key press. Remember, this has Cherry MX Speed switches which requires minimum to none effort at all to actuate a key, the W key also feels different compared to the adjacent keys (e.g. the Q, E, A, S, D) has almost the same feel when bottoming out the keys while the W key feels like a worn-down key.
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a low profile keyboard with quiet Cherry switches. This one does exactly what I wanted it to do. It is easy to mistype a key, but it doesn’t bother me because I don’t do a ton of typing. My kids like the ability to custom choose the colors. I think all keyboards should have the media controls on the keyboard and I won’t buy one without them. The keyboard feels sturdy, looks like it should be easy to clean with compressed air, and was very easy to set up. I hesitated to buy this right away because of the cost, but I am glad I did and would buy another one from Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: This, is a -nice- keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: If you're shopping for a nice keyboard, you've found it. Looking past the computer gaming capabilities, it's tops if you have to type a lot of reports, which is a big part of my job. I'm turning out 100+ page reports per week and this thing helps my fingers become more efficient. I think you'll like the spring-loaded keys as each rebound allows you to move that much more quickly. The only downside is the racket made by the keys. Frankly, it sounds like a pillbox opening up on allied troops. You'll want to use it in a room with sound dampening. Hey, nothing's perfect. This product comes close to it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Cumberbatch

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: My old keyboard was broken not long ago, so i have to buy a new keyboard. My old keyboard was wireless but It wasn't really stable. That's why I searched for a wired keyboard. I really satisfied with my purchase. I not a fan of light on keyboard,so i turned it off since I got the keyboard. I really like the volume scroll which allow me to adjust volume really easily. The thing I like the most about this keyboard is how quiet it is. It's so nice compare with my old keyboard, which is so loud and annoying. So, I think is totally worth to buy this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Chia-Wei

customer_reviews.title: RGB Lighting Failed in Less Than 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a keyboard. RGB lighting failed to work correctly in less than a year. Keys not showing correct colors. For example, all white static coloring display numerous keys as pink(ish): all cyan displays same keys as blue(ish); all red or all blue display OK. Support was OK but none of the "firmware" reset suggestions worked resulting in Corsair recommending I return the KB for replacement. Unfortunately, I cannot go two weeks without a KB for for my rig, so I am stuck with a basic, overpriced KB.
customer_reviews.author: Bill T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a mechanical keyboard for a while and have decided to splurge on this one. I've also wanted a white keyboard to match my white tower case and white mouse. The color and design of this keyboard is just fantastic. I couldn't be more happier and I hope to have this keyboard for some time. The Cherry MX Speed took a day or two to get used to (since I had a pseudo-mechanical keyboard before), but now I can type fast and accurately again :)
customer_reviews.author: Rani Kartikasari

customer_reviews.title: Keys started sticking and repeating even with cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: They keys on my corsair have started sticking and repeating even with monthly cleanings. I tried to submit a claim through the insurance I purchased with it, but it the phone number is just an endless busy signal and you cannot submit a claim through the four square website. It's a scam. Buyer beware. Never buying corsair again.
customer_reviews.author: me.

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB keyboard option
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard with lots of customization potential. Compared to other various keyboards I have owned, the switches definitely compress significantly easier, so if you have heavy fingers, you may accidentally activate keys unintentionally. They’re very quiet, unless you push hard and bottom out the switch, and all keys are very responsive. The usb pass through is a nice addition, and the thicker cable isn’t really a bother when routing.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce L.

customer_reviews.title: It won't stop lighting up
customer_reviews.text: Really hate how this keyboard doesn't have a sleep mode. It will stay on forever and ever and shine weird lights all over the room. Pretty irritating they did not include such a simple feature as - "if I don't touch the keyboard for 10 minutes, turn it off!" so simple!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Fire

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love, love! Best paired w/ silicone keyboard cover
customer_reviews.text: Love love love love love. The colors, the keys, the just grippy enough wrist guard. The white and grey are a beautiful sleek option. My arms, wrists, and hands no longer hurt. Love the white. I do use a silicone key cover to avoid crumbs, dust, or the occasional liquid whoopsie. I take that off weekly and wash the cover. Protects the keys and keyboard well. My teens want their own!! Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA, works once in a while, most of the time does not. Replacement works.
customer_reviews.text: Will update this if I receive a working one. The one I received works on and off. The pass-through USB works fine, but no lights, and none of keys work, yes, tried different USB ports and computers. EDIT: Amazon shipped out a replacement which works. Overall a good keyboard, albeit loud-very loud. So far solid.
customer_reviews.author: PAPA.AMGTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Definite improvement over MK.1 K70
customer_reviews.text: Have both the original and Mk.2 variants of the K70. Once you use these mechanical keyboards, you are never going to go back to a membrane keyboard. The Mk.2 switches are nicer than the original. The all aluminum body is sturdy and stylish. The per-key RGB lighting is very nice - controllable by the Corsair CUE software which allows you to program the lighting to any style of effect you wish. The CUE software is a bit of a steep learning curve, but once you understand how it works, it' gets easier to program. Spoil your eyes, ears and hands - get this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Tiny

customer_reviews.title: Robust and good quality material, but broke in a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard but it's unreliable. After working flawlessly for 2-3 months, suddenly it started to "freeze" and had to be disconnected from the USB port. At the beginning when this issue appeared a simple remove/plug-in would help, but now I have wiggle the contact to get a connection again. Then after 5-10 minutes it stops working again. So now I have an expensive piece of junk I can't use :) As I wrote above, it's a great keyboard with good build quality. And beside the above issue, the only thing I could complain about is that the USB passthrough is 2.0 only. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard Corsair!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I wanted in a keyboard: * Low profile keys. * Quiet while typing. * Mechanical Switches. * The actuation distance is fantastic, it takes very little effort to activate your keys, it's almost as if you only need to whisper and it will type what you wanted. * RGB * Highly configurable software that uses very little system resources. * Sturdy casing, does not flex while pressing down hard. (Not that you need to) * Very little key chatter, the keys are solid, no matter where you press on the key, it will activate. * USB Pass-through * Multi-Media Keys * Wrist wrest
customer_reviews.author: Legacy-ZA

customer_reviews.title: I love you Corsair
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It is great quality materials and well designed. If you don't like the switches Corsair sells alternative sets so you can keep the same board for a while. The keys are elevated so you can see the LED light well and it has the added benefit of making cleaning easier. My only complaint and the reason it gets 4 stars has to do with iCue. The software keeps having trouble with detecting the keyboard. This totally wrecks my lighting-link because I set it to 'keystroke thunder'. (This could also be an issue with my motherboard USB connections)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Overall, really good product.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying that I like this keyboard. I really do. All of the features, and the solidity of the keyboard is top notch. No delays in key pressing in multiple shooters, including Black Ops 4 , Overwatch, and CS-GO. THE ONLY reason I will not give this keyboard a 5 star review, is because the keyboard is too sensitive. Upon barely resting my hand on the keyboard, a key will press, even if its only slightly pressed. Causing many accidental abilities / grenades, ECT to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Toups

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming, learning curve for typists.
customer_reviews.text: Love the weight, the feel, and the lighting. ICUE software isn't the most user friendly (not an issue with the keyboard specifically). Wrist rest is sub par, like all Corsair keyboards. Either don't use it, or replace with the hyper x cooling rest. This keyboard is VERY THIN. I love this. It's very comfortable to type and, has very fast actuation (still causes typos from time to time). Media keys are great, and I love the scroll wheel for volume. I've added pictures so you can see the packaging, keyboard with and without lighting. Also included photo next to my Corsair glaive mouse for size comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but loud
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this keyboard is amazing- comfortable keys, awesome lights, good-quality cord and you can tell a lot of thought went into the design and the details. The only issue I have is that this keyboard is LOUD! I have used many different mechanical keyboards before, and this one really has a loud CLACK no matter how softly you try and type. Still the best keyboard I've ever owned though, so I'd probably get it again. I feel bad for my partner, though!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for user switching from membrane to Mechanical low profile.
customer_reviews.text: Feel amazing ! Almost nothing to complaint about. -Feel Great, -No Ghosting possible, -Volume Scroll wheel is perfect and smooth to turn, -By adding some O-ring the key travel become almost as close as what i was use to with a membrane keyboard. Con: I would have like that Corsair make other type of Cherry Low Profile for a little bit harder actuation force. Just sitting your finger with a tiny bit of weight can be enough to actuate a key if you were use to an actuation force of ~+60g. I got use to it and i don't have this issue anymore.
customer_reviews.author: TwinShards

customer_reviews.title: Was good until SPACE bar started to jam
customer_reviews.text: Bought this purely for FPS, and about 9 months of daily use the space bar is jamming about each 20th press. This is very frustrating in a match for obvious reasons. I use AWSD and so the left thumb presses the space bar on its left side. There must be some design flow in engineering because it started to jam only after some use. Very frustrated, won't buy Corsair keyboard again.
customer_reviews.author: Roman S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard for any gamer looking for a white keyboard
customer_reviews.text: honestly a great keyboard. the material is solid and i don’t worry about the keys getting dirty. the UI for the rgb program is a little confusing at first but once you get the hang of it there’s a lot you can do. the customizable options seem limitless with this keyboard. i have a white themed setup and this was one of the only keyboards i could find that seemed like a good fit and that was high quality and i wasn’t disappointed. stop staring at the price and just buy it you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware - terrible software
customer_reviews.text: The feel of this keyboard is great but I have to give it 2 stars because the corsair software crashed several of my favorite games. Corsair really needs to pay attention to their software since it is such a crucial part of the gaming experience
customer_reviews.author: Steven I. Pousty

customer_reviews.title: It's a masterpiece
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitsant to spend almost 200 shillings for a keyboard and mouse, but I'm glad I did. I play mostly MOBAs and MMOs and this keyboard is perfect. I love being able to program the macros directly from the ICUE software. My favorite feature is that each individual key's LED is addressable. So if you wanted each key to have its own color it is entirely possible. Its super easy to type on, and is top notch quality. I can tell this will last for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: PreVayle

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the *discounted* price, MX speed are a bit too soft.
customer_reviews.text: Overall good keyboard, nice aesthetics. MX speed are a bit too short and soft for my taste (the easily press when a finger mistakenly touches them - mainly happens while gaming with some fingers hovering over A/D keys). Keyboard edges could've been milled/buffed as they sharp and not pleasant for touch.
customer_reviews.author: Tal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for gaming, really takes you to the next level
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased this keyboard and he cannot say enough about it. The keys are amazing and I love that they come with 2 small sets for gaming. The keys are very easy to change and the tool that comes with it is great too. My son feels like this keyboard took him to the next level in gaming where he has a slight edge on his opponent's. The quality of the material is excellent and I love the braided cord.
customer_reviews.author: Saab-Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for price, pain to customize
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great keyboard. The switches for the keys are perfect for games and typing. The iCue software for customization of the lighting effects is tedious and could be so much easier if they added a few simple options. However, other people have powered through and there are a vast amount of effects that you can download and import. The lights are pretty bright, but the video is a bit deceiving. If you have any effect that shifts colors like a grradient there is some white. I'd buy it again if it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, quieter than Cherry MX Brown in the Das Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overall the keyboard is quite nice. The RGB is pretty. Rather than integrating a proper hub they make you use two USB ports with one being the pass through from the back. This, for a $200 keyboard is pretty cheap feeling. Otherwise the keyboard is fantastic. If I could have these keys/switches in a Microsoft Sculpt layout, I'd hack the review system just put in 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: That speeeeeed
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome keyboard, but if you aren't use to the fast actuation switches... this keyboard will make you type slower, due to hitting the wrong keys on accident. I went from typing ~95+ WPM to around ~80'ish, at first, until I got used to it... While playing games, the weight of a finger-tip can activate a key... so you start running sideways! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Eichler

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is fantastic. I got the low profile speed switches because I like a low-effort key press combined with a short throw, and it exceeds my expectations. The build quality is excellent. It's great for both gaming and typing. I do a lot of both, and I couldn't be more pleased. Do your research on the different types of keys, because they vary greatly. Corsair has made me a fan of theirs. Their keyboards scream high end, and they are a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but well worth it! This thing is top of the line. When function AND form are important to you, this is the keyboard to buy. I plug my mic right into the USB port in the back of it. It has the nifty volume adjuster knob, RGB, cherry keys, the works. Aircraft-quality aluminum body, this thing is so slick.
customer_reviews.author: Tandy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this keyboard. The colors are very bright, and you’re able to adjust the brightness in three different presets straight from the keyboard. The colors definitely pop out, and won’t he icue software, there is unlimited amounts of cooors that a person can choose. Very durable, wire is also very thick and stiff. Very solid keycaps and base and is easy to take off the keycaps in case of replacement or cleaning. Personally, I really enjoyed the cherry mx speeds. A lot of people have different tastes, but if you’re looking for something that’s linear, clicky but not too clicky, and has a very fast activation, highly recommend Overall, very nice buy. Definitely recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: JRey Ranoco

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and good mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keystrokes on this board is pretty responsive, I guess they call it rapid fire for a reason. Great for gaming...Has a lot of features to set it up just how you want it and the fact it does come with some extra FPS and MOBA keycaps for extra grip is a plus. Using ICue is still sort of a learning curve but once you take the time setting up and adjusting becomes a breeze lots of video tutorials to get you Through. Man I love this keyboard absolute beast
customer_reviews.author: Techguy1908

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would but again
customer_reviews.text: If you are an RGB fanatic or just want a little extra aesthetics for your gaming room this keyboard is awesome. The MX speed cherry keys are wonderful with minimal input effort. Just be careful that you don’t accidentally nudge a key or you’ll have typos. easy for extended office work and gaming on the wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Really a person!

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Good sound, good feel, good look. Colors are great. the only issue i've had really has been the iCue software required to change colors or themes on the keyboard. It's had to be uninstalled and reinstalled a few times now as the updates gave given me some usability issues with lagging and delays.
customer_reviews.author: Neena

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! But don't get it drunk.
customer_reviews.text: I love Corsair peripherals. My K65 suffered a beer related death but had been amazing for years before it's untimely death. I ordered this keyboard to replace it and love it at least 3.25% more. Wasn't sure I'd like the white but the colors Duke! The colors! The construction is heavy (which I really like) and feels durable. I haven't tested it's alcohol tolerance yet but I don't imagine it would hold out better than it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C

customer_reviews.title: The price is high but worth the quality of the item!
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the price a little bit, but in all honesty you get your money's worth with the overall quality! The cables are thick to prevent the normal damage from pinched wires and pulling. The customization is off the charts with normal keyboards and its smoothest typing I've ever had on a keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: kyle books

customer_reviews.title: Hot Trash
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is gimmicky and not worth your money and more importantly your time. RGB randomly stops working and their iCue app which allows you to set your own keyboard profiles stops working. [before you ask, yes, I have updated drivers, reinstalled the app, switched usb ports, tried on another computer, and even the old restart] Beware...
customer_reviews.author: BryGoesBoom

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of the K70 I've purchased, and it is the best keyboard I've ever used. I'm not a gamer - not even for one second. I'm merely a business man who uses a keyboard way too much, and the keyboards issued with laptops as part of a docking station are getting worse and worse with every release. The K70 is very responsive, and the backlighting allows me to work in a darkened room (my home office).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ooten

customer_reviews.title: Soild, sleek and sexy design
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard and feels very well built! The only downside is I was under the impression the K70 Rgb Mk. 2 model came with the textured WSAD keys but it doesn't. I contacted corsair support and they stayed only the K70 included those keys. Other than that the design is beautiful and keyboard is super sleek. There's not many functions so don't expect any custom macro keys.
customer_reviews.author: Dad's Dojo

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard prevents system from booting
customer_reviews.text: This sounds pretty stupid but I had the keyboard a few days without issues until the system needed a reboot. I had a hell of a time trying to figure out why my computer would not boot. After exhausting all options I tried booting without any input devices plugged in and it started working. Current workaround is to unplug the keyboard before booting, it works fine after that... Keyboard firmware was updated to latest and tried reducing the polling to 125hz, neither fixed the problem. Contacting support but very likely am going to return this keyboard as I never thought that a keyboard could cause a computer to no longer boot.
customer_reviews.author: RoadKillGrill

customer_reviews.title: Great for a week until the double keypresses started
customer_reviews.text: It was a little rough originally, but the keys are smoothing out as it gets used. Unfortunately, the double keypresses started about a week later. About one in ever 1000 keypresses or so results in a double letter. UPDATE: I got a second one in case the first was defective. Have repeating keys right away.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: KEYS DONT ALWAYS WORK
customer_reviews.text: I loved it at first... This week though I started noticing that my Insert / Del / Home / End / Pgu / Pgd keys are unresponsive!!!!!!!! I thought maybe it the the app or whatever, but it started happening in multi different apps!!! And now my return window has passed. WTF. Also, the other night, I couldn't turn off the lights. The button was completely unresponsive. So I had to pull the plug.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Liddell

customer_reviews.title: Fast and responsive
customer_reviews.text: This is a 10/10 keyboard, simple as that. Feels amazing and the presses feel fast and responsive. Sadly though, for how much Corsair products are, they aren't dust or spill resistant. Note: If you really want to take advantage of this keyboard, download iCUE K70 software. You can control the RGB lights, create your own profiles and so much more.
customer_reviews.author: ReallyAdriel

customer_reviews.title: Increases my happiness each day!
customer_reviews.text: While I'm not a gamer, my son recommended this keyboard and I'm glad I listened to his advice. This keyboard is an explosion of fun each time you type. I'm a writer, so I use my keyboard often and this one and its many options for color changes (with app) is so lovely to see and play around with each day. It improves the quality of my day and makes me smile... enough said. I love the mechanical sound by the keys as well... feels substantial and satisfying. Worth the money! Best purchase of the year so far aside from my coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is indeed a really high quality keyboard. I absolutely love the PBT keycaps, and how it amplifies the RGB effects. The keyboard is good to type with, and I am really loving it alot more than my K95 Platinum. I would definitely recommend anyone who wants to buy a good and highend Corsair keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: NegNoodles

customer_reviews.title: Corsair fav keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like corsair products. I had the silent reds before beer ruined it and now I have this. I will probably continue to buy only corsair keyboards because I've liked them so much. Sadly my favorite mouse, which was also corsair, hasn't been made for many years. If only I could find a good mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: My wife already had the black version of this keyboard, but as her PC build has turned more into a white build she wanted her peripherals to match. This keyboard feels even better and more well made that the exact same model purchased 2 years ago. It is a testament to Corsairs dedication to improving their products.
customer_reviews.author: beejc1128

customer_reviews.title: NO EXTRA BUTTONS
customer_reviews.text: This is where Amazon messes up. Stop putting different products on the same page. The SE / Silver edition does NOT come with extra textured keys like the original black version. It DOES look better though. Minus one star for false hope on the extra keys
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was wireless, other then that best keyboard I've ever owned. I own both the regular edition and the special edition and I can tell you the special is noticeable better, the PBT double shot keycaps is much better. I use the regular edition at work and the special edition at home.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. Fast and comfortable gaming and typing
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I was worried going from my razor green switches. Took a little while to adjust to the nk tactile feedback. But the keys are easy to press and amazing response. After a couple days if adjusting to the low profile. It was definitely the right call. Super fast switches for gaming and typing. And the low profile is closer to my typing style of a laptop. Only negative is the extra keypads are designed for the standard depth keypads. So they were not comfortable to use. Kept all the stock key caps on.
customer_reviews.author: pat kearns

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Cusomizable
customer_reviews.text: It really does have everything you would want in a keyboard. All of the functionality is there, and more than that it is so sleek and so elegant looking. It is just the coolest thing I've bought in a long time, and I'm super happy with it. ICUE is way more useful than the keyboard software that exists for competing products.
customer_reviews.author: paulisthewalrus

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS KEYBOARD. I have the low profile version, I've been using it for about 6 weeks now. I use it for transcription and design work and also for gaming. It's the most perfect keyboard I have ever touched. The feel is amazing, I look forward to using it every day. It's quiet, it's precise, it's perfection. My only (small) criticism is that the font on the keys is stylized and gaudy from a graphic designer's overly critical point of view. But that doesn't affect performance. Buy this, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Isael

customer_reviews.title: Epic
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing keyboard. I love how quiet I can type when I don't bottom out. It's basically silent and feels like I'm pressing on marshmallows. The RGB is pretty neat too. You can only save static colors onto onboard memory however which is disappointing. I have it connected to an atolla 7 port usb 3.0 hub and I haven't encountered problems with it. I wish there were more keycap options for low profile switches.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Dope Keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: The RGB is amazing on this keyboard nice and bright the way i like it and really comfortable to use. And has tons of RGB Customization for it too with the program called iCUE that is. Shipping was good and fast. Also the size if the keyboard is perfect for me not too small or too big just right in middle. It was worth every dollar in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Josue

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is literally perfect for my set up's aesthetic. I switched out some of the keycaps for some pink, blue, and purple ones. The iCue software is not too difficult to use, I just watched some tutorials on youtube to help me navigate it. Very comfortable to use and I have always had a good track record with Corsair products. So worth it 👌
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Broken switches-Really want to love it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this keyboard, I really did. My wife got me this keyboard for my birthday in August of 2019 and I've used it for LIGHT gaming since then. The WASD switches (not the keys) get stuck which causes a continuous output in either of the WASD directions. This input won't get unstuck unless I click on the switch again. If this didn't happen, it would be a 5 star keyboard 100%. I'm not sure if mine is defective but like I said, I game extremely lightly. Maybe one or two games of Overwatch after work.
customer_reviews.author: Anzable

customer_reviews.title: Just ordered a second one
customer_reviews.text: First things first: This is the best keyboard I've ever owned. I just decided to write this review as I ordered a second one for office use. I'm a gamer at night and work in software during the day. After being completely blown away using the keyboard at home for gaming I decided I also want to have the extremely pleasant way of typing on this outstanding mechanical keyboard at work.
customer_reviews.author: Jan-Oliver Pantel

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, but USB pass-through very short
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems great with this keyboard. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the lead for the pass-through is split about 8 inches from the end. Not very functional for the intended use of a pass-through without having to get a female-female extender.
customer_reviews.author: G Fnow

customer_reviews.title: A gift to my son
customer_reviews.text: And he just loves it! He's an avid online gamer, and really enjoys this keyboard. A terrific gift he's told me.
customer_reviews.author: T.R.

customer_reviews.title: Gap at the bottom right to the circuit board. Highly vulnerable to water damage.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible keyboard though there is a serious design flaw with a gap that leads right into the circuit board near the spacebar. I'm lucky my keyboard still works though there is no red lighting anymore. While this is my fault, the keyboard still shouldn't be designed like this as it makes the device weak to probably the only form of damage it could receive. If you are clumsy, look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Zendarski

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: The switches are very reactive and I really love the sound and feel of them. The colors are beautiful. I didn't think i would use the wrist rest because I liked my previous one, but use the included one all the time now and won't change back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like mine
customer_reviews.text: The switches were absolutely dead silent and responded unnervingly quickly. iCue carried over my old RGB profile from my previous keyboard flawlessly, despite its flaws such as crashing my entire computer at random. Unfortunately, as soon as my board left the return window, a number of the switches started double-typing while doing normal work and chatting outside of gaming. I put up with it for about 5 months after that and then had to replace the board. I might've gotten a bad egg, but before it malfunctioned, it was the best keyboard I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Evans

customer_reviews.title: A great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have had the earlier model of this keyboard since the week it came out which lasted me over 3 years only needing to replace it due to me spilling some piping coffee on the surface of the keys ( my fault ). The keyboards quality is high due to it being constructed mainly of metal with exception to the key caps and media keys. This keyboard literally only has one draw back and its picky to say the least. My only complaint is that the media keys are not metal like the rest of the keyboard... Yep thats it, I love this keyboard and im positive it will not disappoint you.
customer_reviews.author: chase dusina

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard despite the lighting software
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is built like a tank. I will have this keyboard indefinitely. The free downloadable software for the lighting effects is the equivalent of untangling a box of coat hangers & Christmas lights while trying to solve a jigsaw puzzle with the picture side down.
customer_reviews.author: schlickdendine

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard- a little pricey, but still no buyer's remorse here
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good- looks great and functions well the cherry MX speeds are not bad, they don't feel ideal to type on, but the actuation point is high and the full travel is really short so pressing down on a key is practically effortless. I wish there was a tactile 'bump' on some of the keys though, mainly the shift and ctrl keys cause sometimes I can't tell if I'm pressing on it all the way or not.
customer_reviews.author: Trent BurgrMeistr

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT IS OFF BALANCE AND JIGGLES ON MY DESK
customer_reviews.text: Received the keyboard with great expectations. Set everything up and the damn thing is off balanced or something because it wiggles when the keyboard stands are up or down. Started as a minor inconvenience but the more I use the keyboard the more irritating it becomes. I've tried examining the keyboard to ascertain the cause of the inbalance but can find no obvious signs of why the keyboard does not remain stationary.
customer_reviews.author: Jerad

customer_reviews.title: This board is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: After using it for a few months, I plan on using it for a very long time. The why keys with the silver frame go so well together not to mention the LED's look so good. I like how they come with different variety of lighting options, the customization options are the best. Would definitely recommend buying it, although its not clicky-clicky.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Armani Lovinaria

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale for a great price and love it! The Cherry MX Speeds are an amazing switch! I love the iCue customization of the RGB colors. The only gripe I would have is the ergonomics. I most defiantly notice a change in feel from my previous keyboard. This is my first gaming/mechanical keyboard so it could be some getting used to still. I would say it feels about 90% perfect! Other than that this keyboard is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, RGB the best
customer_reviews.text: I think my keyboard from omen laptop has faster reaction because the key travel is really short ,I can easily slide my finger to another key and change my movements. But still, this new keyboard is comfortable for typing and pbt key are high durable. And RGB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It increase my game level about 200% XD, customizing the RGB light just like programming (or doing photoshop). Main reason I bought this keyboard is my omen laptop’s keyboard is right above the cpu and gpu, 45 degree Celsius just make me feel like I grilled my hands :D
customer_reviews.author: Haining Xu

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: The last time I had a keyboard that made me this happy was a Microsoft X4 unit. If they weren't out of production I would have probably bought another one. I tried an Asus and the keys started breaking really fast. The little plastic parts that keep the keys one would break off for no apparent reason. This Corsair keyboard looks amazing, has a great feel and best of all is still in one piece.!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Backus

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've had several gaming keyboards, but I never utilized all the extra keys, but loved having the LCD screen on them. This keyboard doesn't have an LCD screen, but it's sleek design and full RGB integration with other corsair products made it very appealing. iCue took a little getting use to as I'd only used corsair LINK for my RAM. But iCue won't recognize my brand new vengeance PRO RGB modules. That's another review though. They keyboard is beautiful and compliments all my other components.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely outstanding! I am incredibly happy with this K70, I love the Low-Profile and Audio Buttons that are on it. Came with several different keys and a Key-Cap Remover. I reccomend this Keyboard to any gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming keyboard out there
customer_reviews.text: I already became a fan of Corsair MK series with my previous one, after trying to so many other brands, I found the MK series to be the best quality/feeling/durability keyboard. The only reason I bought this one to replace my old MK series is because I changed the theme of my gaming setup to white, but that old MK series was still rocking after 4 years of spills and heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard but the software is bad
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard by its self is good nothing wrong with it, but when you start using the software problems start emerging. like for example when I press the key "1" it types "~1533" or other random numbers. however, the problem goes away when I turn off the software and works fine no problems. The best solution I found if you went to use Keybinds is to save them on the keyboard its self then exits the software. The software needs to fix the bugs. Otherwise, the hardware is good no problem with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sami hks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this keyboard. This is my first Corsair keyboard and I can say that I will continue to use their products. The keyboard is very sturdy, has great weight to it and the keys are just perfect. It has the mechanical feel but its nice and quiet while still giving you that beautiful 'click' sound. I was worried that the keys would get dirty after just a few uses, but if you keep your hands clean its not an issue. If they get dirty a microfiber cloth does the trick. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ruskov

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming especially if you come from regular laptop use
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, exactly what I was looking for--a low profile keyboard with quick switches. Coming from using a macbook, I tried using the magic keyboard for gaming (and a blue switch keyboard before that), which worked for a while but left something to be desired size-wise. Found this K70 and so far it's great. Pretty RGB lights and feels perfect so far. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: smooth as silk :)
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a Razor to the Corsair K70 RGB MK.2 Rapidfire with the Cherry Red Speed keys and OMG! Huge difference! Not loud at all, nice and smooth, very fast key strokes, and tons of ways to optimize your particular settings. I love the roller type volume control. Came with key puller and ASWD keys. The braided keyboard cord is fat, and have had absolutely zero issues thus far. Being my only Corsair product, I can not comment on the compatibility of the lighting with other iCue products. Hope this helps :)
customer_reviews.author: Kitsune

customer_reviews.title: If u are afraid of miss typing dont choose this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: so far i've been using this keyboard for around 3 months and once you get use to it it works fine (doesnt feel premium or fast) just the travel of the key is shorter if u want real speed just choose opto-mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Maxter

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, fluid and great balance of everything
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a razer blackwidow as my first keyboard for about 3 years. It was cool and all, but i grew to get annoyed at how clicky the keys were and large the keyboard was. I've started using the K70 and everything about it feels better. The MX speed keys are really nice and easy to hit with solid tactile feedback, all without being obnoxiously loud. Keys are high off the keyboard base so you get a lot of room for RGB to show off.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P. Poinsett

customer_reviews.title: quality keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard and I love it. I've been using it for a little over a month now. It's great for gaming but also very nice feel for typing. Solid build material, and keys feel great and the lighting is quite nice. The volume wheel should be on every keyboard made. I don't care much for the icue software that controls the lighting, but the keyboard itself is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard. Wonderful and durable as hell. The keyboard itself is solid metal. The keys are great and easily replaced if the keyface gets damaged or need to be cleaned. The customer service is still great even in this crisis with it being a bit slowed down a bit. The cord is braided and feels beautiful and very sturdy. This cord lasted through some abuse. It has gone through hell for more than a year before it finally gave out and now the customer service is being extremely helpful and as fast as they can in the current crisis.
customer_reviews.author: Olga Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Can’t stop using it. I’m writing letters now so I get to use it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it. Too many features to list. Coming from a basic keyboard this is like leaving the cave and jumping into a Tesla. Can’t rave enough about it. Both the keyboard and the mouse are amazing
customer_reviews.author: Christiaan P. Van Der Put

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard ever.
customer_reviews.text: First time buying a gaming keyboard, and I have to say......... Money WELL SPENT! I was hesitant about spending so much money on a keyboard but I do not regret it at all. It's extremely beautiful and goes well with any type of setup. I bought the silver with white that comes with a mouse and I could not be any happier about my purchase. Corsair definitely stepped up its game.
customer_reviews.author: Ping N.

customer_reviews.title: Even better in person
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing to have as a keyboard. It’s very unique in terms of aesthetic, and it’s RGB light display looks 100 times better because of the aluminum backplate. The exposed switch design also enhances the brightness of the RGB lights so this will out-display any other RGB keyboard during the day, so just wait until you see it light up at night. The software and lighting is much more reliable than Razer, not gonna lie. Hands down one of the best purchases I’ve purchased on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: if you thnking of buying K70 RGB get the MK1 this is just feels worse
customer_reviews.text: had both keyboard and the MK.2 feels cheaper, the key and body sound holow and less qulity, i stil use the MK.1 at work and i find it much more setespiing to use, th only reason i dont use the MK.1 at hom is that some of the light havve stopped working on the keyboard and they change randomly and fliker.
customer_reviews.author: Reznik Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard and looks amazing
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great keyboard and the RGB looks stellar. I’ve had it for a few days and I’m in love with it. The only minor flaw I could notice is that the keys are very sensitive so accidental key presses are likely. This could just be me adjusting to it though as I’m coming from an iMac keyboard that is much less sensitive. I’ll update the review once I’ve had more time with it
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Feel!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels great to me. I can type very fast and the sound is not super loud like other mechanical keyboards. My previous keyboard was a Corsair Strafe RGB, which is very similar, but I like this one quite a bit more. The Rapidfire Mk2 picked up all my existing lighting profiles from my previous Strafe, so I barely had to configure it at all.
customer_reviews.author: K. R. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Very colorful!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality... I’ve never used a keyboard this nice before. The RBG keys are bright, clean, and easy. Very crisp feeling actuation. Not as loud as I expected either!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Came with aesthetic damage out of box
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed as this is a Christmas present. There are scuff marks on the media keys out of box. I’m getting a replacement sent but it won’t arrive until the 29th. Real bummer. The keyboard itself is nice.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WHEN RESTARTING PC OR PUTTING IT TO SLEEP... DO NOT BUY THIS KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a while now and at first it was great, but after a while it started acting up. Whenever I restarted I noticed that upon reboot the keyboard wouldn't get detected, backlight wouldn't work and iCue wouldn't recognize the keyboard so every time I have to plug and unplug the keyboard, it's annoying as hell. Apparently i'm not the only one with this issue, there's a lot of reports of this happening to others... I'm never buying from Corsair again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It constantly stops working.
customer_reviews.text: For this type of high-end keyboard, it constantly stops working. I do not recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Urtecho

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Everything was perfedt except the wrist rest was a but slippery Just one con but was resolved for me Some youtubers unboxing videos for this keyboard had the moba+fps keycaps +keycap puller as included in the box but turns out when i visited their website it did not state that they were included tho i contacted corsair and tgey happily shipped over the keycaps+puller and again corsair customer service is one of the best
customer_reviews.author: ابراهيم سرور

product_meta.title: Corsair K70 RGB MK.2 Rapidfire Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - USB Passthrough & Media Controls - Fastest & Linear - Cherry MX Speed - RGB LED Backlit
product_meta.description: Style:Standard| Size:Keyboard| Color:RGBThe CORSAIR K70 RGB MK.2 RAPIDFIRE is a premium mechanical gaming keyboard built to last. Equipped with a lightweight durable aluminum frame and CHERRY MX Speed key switches, it boasts the reliability and accuracy you demand with blistering fast 1.2mm actuation. Powerful CORSAIR iCUE software enables sophisticated macro programming, vivid dynamic multicolor illumination and full system lighting synchronization. With 8MB of dedicated onboard memory and hardware playback, you can take all your settings with you. A host of extras put your PC at your fingertips, with USB pass through, dedicated multimedia controls, a detachable soft touch wrist rest and textured FPS and MOBA keycaps making it easy to play your way and minimize interruptions. It's the most amazing K70 keyboard yet.
feature_bullets: Aircraft grade anodized brushed aluminum frame, built to withstand a lifetime of gaming
8MB profile storage with hardware macro and lighting playback allow access to up to three stored profiles on the go, independent of external software
Per key dynamic multi color RGB backlighting offers near unlimited color customization and control
USB pass through port provides convenient access to an additional USB port for your mouse or headset
CORSAIR iCUE software enables vivid dynamic lighting control, sophisticated macro programming and full system lighting synchronization across compatible CORSAIR peripherals, coolers, fans and more
Get the RAPIDFIRE advantage CHERRY MX Speed mechanical key switches provide the reliability and accuracy you demand, with blistering fast 1.2 millimeter actuation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,742 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
